channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 很少有剧集能像《王冠》这样稳定地刺激观众，其中很多内容都是无稽之谈。历史可能是它的问题所在，但历史也是它的魅力所在👇。
item.description:
Few shows irritate audiences as reliably as “The Crown”, much of which is nonsense. History might be problematic for it—but history is also part of the appeal https://t.co/uDEGFZoiLf 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 25, 2024

item.title: 多年来，中国农民进城是为了获得更好的医疗和教育。"山高水长》探讨了为什么城市人现在要反其道而行之👇。

item.description:

item.title: 通货紧缩比高峰时期低得多，但仍未被击垮。要了解发生了什么，就要看看需求模式。当今问题的根源在于全球服务价格的上涨👇。
item.description:
Inﬂation is much lower than at its peak, but it has not yet been defeated. To understand what is going on, look at the pattern of de­mand. The source of today’s problem is rises in the price of global services https://t.co/To9uv0lPlf 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 25, 2024

item.title: "我们不需要单独作战，也不需要单独防御。@Gottemoeller在我们的 "制衡 "播客中解释了为什么北约对美国很重要🎧。
item.description:
“We don’t need to fight alone, and we don’t need to defend alone.” @Gottemoeller explains why NATO is important to America, on our “Checks and Balance” podcast https://t.co/ugJyg3ZfH8 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 25, 2024

item.title: 在日本的零利率政策下，将现金囤积在银行几乎得不到任何回报。现在的通货膨胀率约为 3%，这意味着任何没有用于工作的现金的价值都在被侵蚀。这促使更多的日本年轻人进行投资 👇。
item.description:
Under Japan’s zero-interest-rate policy, hoarding cash in a bank brings almost no return. Inflation now stands at around 3%, meaning the value of any not put to work is being eroded.

That is prompting more young Japanese to invest https://t.co/HqNrId1efp 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 25, 2024

item.title: 雄心勃勃的女性尽可能地努力变瘦，这在经济上是合理的。这是一个悲剧👇。
item.description:
It is economically rational for ambitious women to try as hard as possible to be thin. That is a tragedy https://t.co/7nMLqHYlMH 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 25, 2024

item.title: 晚婚、更努力地工作和更好地为人父母减少了男性的友谊。美国男性比其他地方的男性更孤独👇。
item.description:
Marrying later, working harder and being better parents have diminished male friendships. Men are lonelier in America than elsewhere https://t.co/C19GrRlUtb 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 25, 2024

item.title: 2010 年代，由于投资者竞相从最热门的初创企业中分一杯羹，科技公司几乎不需要从公开市场获取资金。现在，投资者正在考虑如何出售昔日独角兽公司的股份🦄。
item.description:
In the 2010s, as investors raced to get a piece of the buzziest startups, tech ﬁrms had little need to tap public markets for capital. Now investors are mulling how to sell their stakes in the unicorns of yesteryear https://t.co/wWsnd42d3S 🦄

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 24, 2024

item.title: 您能猜到美国最爱狗的城市在哪里吗？在你的狗窝之外？提示：不是旧金山或纽约 🐕

item.title: 漫威的衰落令人惊讶：长期以来，这个品牌似乎所向披靡。迪斯尼内部人士认为，漫威的衰落有几个原因 👇
item.description:
